isis.stitle: RECONDITIONING ROTORS - INSPECTION - EXCITER RING TEETH

svcproc.title: EXCITER RING TEETH
svcproc.para:
Visually inspect the exciter ring teeth ( Figure 3
) for damage and/or excessive runout. Due to the fact that the exciter ring teeth are an integral part of the rotor, any damage or excessive runout requires replacement of the rotor. Using a feeler gauge, measure any gap between the rotor exciter ring teeth and the sensor. The gap must be less than .025 inch for proper signal output. If runout exceeds .025 inch, check hub assembly for proper bearing adjustment endplay, bearing endplay should not exceed .005 inch. Refer to GROUP 17-WHEELS, RIMS AND TIRES in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
